results.title: Telestreet: the Italian Media Jacking Movement
results.brief_description: “Telestreet” is a network of pirate micro TV transmitters set up by media activists across Italy. Since beginning in June 2002 there are now almost 200 stations throughout the country. This documentary contains interviews with some of those media activists.

results.title: Starting Embroidery (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Maggie Clarke, Pat Marshall and MSI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Joy for Life”.
There are many beautiful and fascinating styles of embroidery practised around the world. “Starting embroidery” will show you the materials you need, how to work some basic stitches and some attractive items which are easy to make. Hannah Gordon introduces the many possibilities embroidery offers to everyone, young and old.

results.title: Starting Crochet (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Maggie Clarke, Pat Marshall and MSI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Joy for Life”.
Crochet is a soothing, rhythmic craft, practised throughout the world for thousands of years - using only a hook and a length of thread. This video and its accompanying booklet will show you how to begin, the materials you need, how to work some basic stitches, as well as some attractive items which are easy to make. Introduced by Hannah Gordon.

results.title: Heaps good: Muph n Plutonic
results.brief_description: This music video featuring animation was made by Melbourne-based video artist and animator, Anto Skene. ‘Heaps Good’ is a track from the first collaboration of acclaimed Melbourne hip hop artist MC Muphin and one of Australia’s highest profile producers, Plutonic Lab. Quality local production featuring hot local sounds.

results.title: Starting Tapestry
results.creator_credit: Maggie Clarke, Pat Marshall and MSI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Joy for Life”.
There is a wonderfully rich variety of tapestry styles throughout the world, and the techniques are easy to learn. This video and its accompanying booklet will show you how to begin, the materials you need, how to work some basic stitches and some attractive items which are easy to make. Introduced by Hannah Gordon.

results.title: Deadly Treadlies: out bush
results.brief_description:
Deadly Treadlies is a bike-rebuilding project that has operated out of Alice Springs, in local town camps and in remote Aboriginal communities since January 2003. The project was initiated in response to young people identifying bikes as a popular alternative to petrol sniffing and other substance and solvent abuse. The project has worked with over 500 young people since its inception in local town camps, schools, drop-in centres and on remote communities. In conjunction with the bike building, a series of video workshops were run and Deadly Treadlies uses footage taken by young people from Santa Teresa, Papunya and Titjikala communities.
More info at http://www.asyass.org.au

results.title: A Japanese Fairy Tale
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: The Moonbeam princess
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Japanese Fairy Tale”.
A charming Japanese fairytale about a little princess who came to earth on a moonbeam. Three princes who seek her hand in marriage go in search of three rare and precious gifts to give her. Animated puppet figures in beautiful authentic costumes and background settings give a delightful artistic flavour to this original story.
